data.boring_theme: going to the petrol station to pump diesel into a vehicle
data.output: I wondered about the puddle of petrol outside my house, near the front door. Had it have been diesel, I would have been less worried. The problem was that I had no idea whether the fuel pump in my vehicle was faulty ot not; the alternative was that someone was out to get me. Although I had few enemies, I knew the most likely culprit, but she was overseas on vacation. Knowing that, I scattered sand on the puddle and stopped worrying.

data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it
data.output: The stamp was clean, unused and valid, but too small a denomination for the letter I had written. This rendered the stamp utterly useless but I did not want to waste it. So, I opened up my finished letter, and used it as a basis to write a much shorter note, which rendered the missive lighter, and the stamp was now useful. Of course, it was now destined elsewhere, and my original letter was unsent. But I chose to send the shorter letter and decided to hold on to the longer one until my correspondent's next birthday!

data.boring_theme: having an organ empire and complying with regulations
data.output: The organ was terribly loud. The organist was pumping away like fury, playing music written to celebrate the Empire; practicing his vigourous harmonies to perfection. It was a wonder to hear it. I was thrilled to bits to see the extent to which he wet in order to comply with my wishes for the upcoming celebrations. The Empire has not been forgotten and we will proudly march into the hall to this, the most stirring of music.

data.boring_theme: the feeling of gloom you have about an existing payment
data.output: What a terrible day; a day to end all days. Just when I thought I had got ahead of the endless cycle of bills and their payment, when I had finally begun to emerge from the gloom of depression, once again able to contemplate socializing; the news of this new debt was a hammer blow. How could this unknown debt exist? I was going to have to double down and focus on total austerity.
